column4: I just installed ubuntu - desktop version.. and I got to where it said to restart, removed cd.. and now when I start it up... it takes FOREEVER, and then it gets to the "wait icon" which is there forever.. EVENTUALLY login screen... and all this time the cursor moves around SOO slowly

I just installed ubuntu - desktop version.. and I got to where it said to restart, removed cd.. and now when I start it up... it takes FOREEVER, and then it gets to the "wait icon" which is there forever.. EVENTUALLY login screen... and all this time the cursor moves around SOO slowly
what kind of computer you got?
SUPER slow. I never actually saw it load.. left it.. and eventually got a gnome error
It might be the computer itself
well it was previously running windows, whihc ran fine...
hmm.. well, I also remember running lindows on it before..
Resources on the computer might not be so great try a lower end distro
I'm with mseney... try wiping everything again... By default it really shouldn't be that slow and I'm sure you didn't add anything to make it that slow right?
Let me know how it all works out for ya... I have never run into that problem in all the time I have worked with linux
